keyTakeAways: Los Angeles District Attorney George Gascón has recommended that a judge resentence Lyle and Erik Menendez, who were convicted in 1996 of murdering their parents in 1989.
The recommendation is based on new evidence of sexual and physical abuse by their father, Jose Menendez, and a new California law allowing resentencing in cases involving abuse and rehabilitation.
Gascón argues that the brothers have rehabilitated, have served their time, and are now eligible for parole under California’s youthful parole provisions due to their age at the time of the crime.
The decision follows a 2023 habeas corpus petition that sought to introduce new evidence, including a sworn statement by Roy Rosselló and a letter from Erik Menendez, alleging abuse.
Public interest has been reinvigorated by the 2023 Netflix series 'Monsters: The Lyle and Erik Menendez Story' and a related documentary.

Critics and supporters alike have debated whether the recommendation is a fair application of justice or a political move, though Gascón insists it reflects evolving societal understanding of abuse and sentencing.
The case has drawn attention from celebrities like Kim Kardashian, who supports the brothers’ cause, and from family members like Jose Menendez’s niece, who called the decision 'brave and necessary'.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Los Angeles County District Attorney George Gascón has announced that he will recommend resentencing for Lyle and Erik Menendez, who were convicted in 1996 of murdering their parents, Jose and Kitty, in 1989. The decision follows a 2023 habeas corpus petition citing new evidence—including a sworn statement from Roy Rosselló alleging abuse by their father and a letter from Erik Menendez—along with California’s updated resentencing law that considers abuse and rehabilitation. Gascón asserts that the brothers have rehabilitated, served their time, and are eligible for parole under youthful parole provisions due to their age at the time of the crime. The case has gained renewed public attention due to Netflix's 2023 series and documentary. While opponents have questioned the decision’s impartiality, Gascón emphasizes it reflects a shift in societal understanding of abuse and justice. A hearing on the recommendation is expected within 30 to 45 days, with a final decision resting with the Los Angeles Superior Court.
title: Los Angeles District Attorney Recommends Resentencing in Decades-Old Menendez Brothers Murder Case
